results.title: When You Love — and Loathe — Watching the N.F.L.
results.abstract: The return of professional football to a nation living on a raw and perilous edge, struggling to confront a lethal virus and trying to heal its deep racial wounds, offered fans a tense and unlikely paradox.

multimedia.caption: Several players on the Los Angeles Rams kneel — and stand— during the playing of the national anthem, as the N.F.L. season got into full swing Sunday.
Several players on the Los Angeles Rams kneel — and stand— during the playing of the national anthem, as the N.F.L. season got into full swing Sunday.

results.title: The Eerie Silence of an N.F.L. Stadium Makes the Game Even More for TV
results.abstract: The Superdome in New Orleans had a dystopian feel as football returned without one of its most loyal congregations. Oh, and Tom Brady flopped as the Saints beat the Buccaneers, 34-23.

multimedia.caption: “A whisper compared to what it normally is,” Saints quarterback Drew Brees said, describing the vibe on Sunday at the Superdome.

results.title: What We Learned From Week 1 of the N.F.L. Season
results.abstract: Cam Newton looked terrific, Tom Brady looked fairly terrible, and there were upsets all over the place in a wild slate of games.

multimedia.caption: In his first game for the Patriots, Cam Newton rushed for 75 yards and two touchdowns. New England beat Miami, 21-11.

results.title: This U.S. Open Will Be Judged by the Future of Osaka and Thiem
results.abstract: Does this Grand Slam title deserve an asterisk given the absence of so many stars? Not if Dominic Thiem and Naomi Osaka endure at the top of the sport. They appear on track for just that.

results.abstract: College sports leaders aren’t thrilled to see football assume a role in the presidential campaign, but they’re not surprised.

results.title: Catch the N.F.L.’s Big Return
results.abstract: For many fans, sports weren’t really back until football kicked off. Well, that moment has arrived.

results.title: The Orioles Looked Done. Now They’re Threatening the Yankees’ Playoff Plans.
results.abstract: “We’re young and I think a lot of people underestimated us, and that’s kind of fun,” said Baltimore’s Pat Valaika. Even more fun for the Orioles would be taking the Yankees’ playoff spot.

results.title: Chiefs’ New Normal Looks Familiar in Win Over Texans
results.abstract: Kansas City’s Super Bowl title defense began with boos from a reduced capacity home crowd and ended with a resounding victory.

results.title: For U.S. Open Contenders Medvedev and Zverev, a Journey From Russia Was a Big Step
results.abstract: Daniil Medvedev and Alexander Zverev are part of a talented final four, all seeking their first Grand Slam title.

multimedia.caption: Alexander Zverev is the German-born son of Russian tennis professionals.

results.title: For the Men’s Doubles Champs, One Constant Holds: ‘A Grand Slam Is a Grand Slam’
results.abstract: In a United States Open with a reduced field and protocols that discouraged players from high-fiving, Mate Pavic and Bruno Soares won their first major title together in straight sets.

multimedia.caption: Mate Pavic, left, and Bruno Soares won their first Grand Slam doubles title together.

results.title: Victoria Azarenka Beats Serena Williams in Comeback to Reach U.S. Open Final
results.abstract: Williams was hurt in the third set of a tight match. Azarenka will face Naomi Osaka in the final.

multimedia.caption: Serena Williams lost after hurting her left ankle or foot during the third set.
